title: Mattel unveils a Barbie with Down syndrome
description: The company has been moving to diversify its doll collection. It has so far made other Barbie and Ken dolls with wheelchairs, vitiligo, hearing aids, and prosthetic limbs.

title: A tobacco giant will pay $629 million for violating U.S. sanctions against North Korea
description: British American Tobacco, one of the largest tobacco companies in the world, agreed to settle allegations that it did illegal business with Pyongyang in violation of U.S. sanctions.

title: What lessons have we learned from the COVID pandemic?
description: The nonpartisan Covid Crisis Group has released its investigative report, titled "Lessons from the Covid War: An Investigative Report." This is what it found.

title: Book bans are getting everyone's attention — including Biden's. Here's why
description: Everyone from the president of the United States to community organizers are paying attention to this obstinate trend.

title: Texas agriculture department's new dress code is based on 'biological gender'
description: Under a new dress code issued by Texas Agriculture Commissioner Sid Miller, department employees are expected to comply "in a manner consistent with their biological gender."

title: Prince William got a 'very large sum' in a Murdoch settlement in 2020
description: Prince William received a large payout in 2020 from Rupert Murdoch's British newspaper arm in an alleged phone hacking case, according to court documents made public Tuesday.

title: Montana GOP doubles down after blocking trans lawmaker from speaking, citing decorum
description: Protesters rallied in support of trans lawmaker, Zooey Zephyr, after she was barred from speaking following her controversial comments on trans-related legislation, but Republicans aren't letting up.

title: 8 members of an Oklahoma family found dead at burning home were shot, autopsies show
description: The parents living at the home where they and their children died last October were experiencing financial difficulties, family members previously told a local newspaper.

title: Contact is lost with a Japanese spacecraft attempting to land on the moon
description: A Japanese company tried to land the unmanned Hakuto spacecraft on the moon early Wednesday, but its fate was unknown as flight controllers lost contact with it moments before the planned touchdown.

title: Diet culture can hurt kids. This author advises parents to reclaim the word 'fat'
description: Journalist Virginia Sole-Smith says efforts to fight childhood obesity have caused kids to absorb an onslaught of body-shaming messages. Her new book is Fat Talk.

title: 'Dark Brandon' meme makes an appearance on Biden's new campaign website
description: President Biden's 2024 reelection campaign team has embraced his darker alter ego — "Dark Brandon," featuring beaming red laser eyes. It shows up on error pages and T-shirts.

title: 'House of Cotton' is a bizarre, uncomfortable read — in the best way possible
description: Monica Brashears debut novel is peculiar and slightly surreal. But it's also dazzling, full of surprises, and told with a voice that's unpredictable and — more importantly — one that lingers.

title: Poll: Republicans think Trump should be president — even if he's convicted of a crime
description: Rank-and-file GOP voters seem largely undeterred by the multiple criminal investigations against the former president.

title: Proud Boys operated as fighting force for Trump on Jan. 6, prosecutors say
description: Closing arguments in the landmark seditious conspiracy trial against five Proud Boys focused on their own words and the words of former President Trump.

title: Harry Belafonte, singer, actor and activist, has died at age 96
description: The iconic and barrier-breaking performer died Tuesday of congestive heart failure.

title: In Oklahoma, a woman was told to wait until she's 'crashing' for abortion care
description: A new study shows women who call the hospitals in Oklahoma get confusing information about the state's abortion bans. One family lived through that confusion with dire consequences last month.

title: Who is Julie Chávez Rodriguez, Biden's reelection campaign manager
description: The granddaughter of the late labor leader César Chávez, Julia Chávez Rodriguez has a background in community organizing, politics and government.

title: The truth about teens, social media and the mental health crisis
description: A striking decline in teen mental health has coincided with the rise of smartphones and social media. Is social media causing the mental health challenges? Finally, research can answer that question.

title: North Dakota's governor has signed a law banning nearly all abortions
description: The state has now adopted one of the strictest anti-abortion laws in the country, with slim exceptions up to six weeks' gestation in cases of rape, incest or medical emergency.

title: House Republicans hope their debt limit bill will get Biden to the negotiating table
description: The House plans to vote on its debt ceiling bill this week. Rep. Dusty Johnson, R.-S.C., calls it an "opening negotiation position" as the risk of a default looms.

title: If Congress doesn't raise the debt limit soon, the U.S. risks defaulting
description: NPR's A Martinez speaks with Republican Rep. Dusty Johnson of South Dakota about the GOP proposal to deal with the country's growing debt in return for raising the debt ceiling.

title: Warring factions in Sudan have agreed to a temporary truce
description: U.S. Ambassador to the U.N. Linda Thomas-Greenfield says the U.S. hopes the three-day truce between two military forces will be extended.

title: President Biden officially declares he's running for reelection
description: At 80, President Biden is the oldest person to serve in the office. He cast his decision to run again as a fight for personal freedoms.

title: How Tucker Carlson took fringe conspiracy theories to a mass audience
description: Many of the false narratives Carlson promoted were part of the "great replacement" conspiracy theory, the racist fiction that non-white people are being brought into the U.S. to replace white voters.

title: When your boss is an algorithm
description: Drivers for Uber and Lyft say the apps promote wage discrimination.

title: North Korean defectors may face deportation by China as COVID border controls ease
description: China usually sends defectors back to North Korea, but Pyongyang wouldn't let them in during the pandemic. That may soon change, and has led to concern among human rights advocates.

title: 5 things to know as E. Jean Carroll's civil trial begins against Donald Trump
description: Jury selection starts Tuesday in Manhattan in the sexual assault and defamation civil suit against former President Trump. E. Jean Carroll accuses Trump of raping her in the 1990s.

title: As teacher shortages loom, one district grows future educators in high school
description: A school district in San Antonio, Texas, has built an entire high school dedicated to raising the next generation of teachers. It's a bold experiment that could pay off big if shortages continue.

title: A Nashville senior was banned from prom for a suit, so a local business stepped in
description: B Hayes, an 18-year-old student at Nashville Christian School, was banned from going to their prom because they wore a suit and not a dress. The school said it "has established dress requirements."

title: Abortion policies could make the Republican Party's 'suburban women problem' worse
description: With the Supreme Court weighing in on abortion — again — voters are once again contending with which party best represents their views on the issue.

title: ESPN announces layoffs as part of Disney's moves to cut costs
description: ESPN was not part of the first phase of Disney reductions. Besides this week's layoffs, another round of job cuts will take place by the start of summer. Both phases impact off-air employees.

title: President Biden says his top domestic policy adviser, Susan Rice, is leaving
description: As director of the White House Domestic Policy Council, Susan Rice had broad sway on the administration's approach to health care, immigration and racial inequality.

title: The 2-year-old boy who was found in an alligator's mouth was drowned, police say
description: Two-year-old Taylen Mosley went missing and was found dead shortly after his mother was found dead from stab wounds in March. Mosley's father has been arrested in connection to both deaths.
